db:abstract.db:para: The QVersionNumber class contains a version number with an arbitrary number of segments.
This class was introduced in Qt 5.6.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QVersionNumber::QVersionNumber()
db:section.db:para: Produces a null version.

db:section.db:title: [default] QVersionNumber::QVersionNumber(QVector<int> &&seg)
db:section.db:para: Move-constructs a version number from the list of numbers contained in seg.
This constructor is only enabled if the compiler supports C++11 move semantics.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QVersionNumber::QVersionNumber(const QVector<int> &seg)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a version number from the list of numbers contained in seg.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QVersionNumber::QVersionNumber(int args)
db:section.db:para: Construct a version number from the std::initializer_list specified by args.
This constructor is only enabled if the compiler supports C++11 initializer lists.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QVersionNumber::QVersionNumber(int maj, int min)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QVersionNumber consisting of the major and minor version numbers maj and min, respectively.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QVersionNumber::QVersionNumber(int maj, int min, int mic)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QVersionNumber consisting of the major, minor, and micro version numbers maj, min and mic, respectively.

db:section.db:title: [static] QVersionNumber QVersionNumber::commonPrefix(const QVersionNumber &v1, const QVersionNumber &v2)
db:section.db:para: QVersionNumber QVersionNumber::commonPrefix(const QVersionNumber &v1, const QVersionNumber &v2)
Returns a version number that is a parent version of both v1 and v2.

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept] int QVersionNumber::compare(const QVersionNumber &v1, const QVersionNumber &v2)
db:section.db:para: Compares v1 with v2 and returns an integer less than, equal to, or greater than zero, depending on whether v1 is less than, equal to, or greater than v2, respectively.
Comparisons are performed by comparing the segments of v1 and v2 starting at index 0 and working towards the end of the longer list.

db:section.db:title: [static] QVersionNumber QVersionNumber::fromString(const QString &string, int *suffixIndex = Q_NULLPTR)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QVersionNumber from a specially formatted string of non-negative decimal numbers delimited by '.'.
Once the numerical segments have been parsed, the remainder of the string is considered to be the suffix string. The start index of that string will be stored in suffixIndex if it is not null.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QVersionNumber::isNormalized() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the version number does not contain any trailing zeros, otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QVersionNumber::isNull() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if there are zero numerical segments, otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool QVersionNumber::isPrefixOf(const QVersionNumber &other) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the current version number is contained in the other version number, otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] int QVersionNumber::majorVersion() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the major version number, that is, the first segment. This function is equivalent to segmentAt(0). If this QVersionNumber object is null, this function returns 0.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] int QVersionNumber::microVersion() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the micro version number, that is, the third segment. This function is equivalent to segmentAt(2). If this QVersionNumber object does not contain a micro number, this function returns 0.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] int QVersionNumber::minorVersion() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the minor version number, that is, the second segment. This function is equivalent to segmentAt(1). If this QVersionNumber object does not contain a minor number, this function returns 0.

db:section.db:title: QVersionNumber QVersionNumber::normalized() const
db:section.db:para: Returns an equivalent version number but with all trailing zeros removed.
To check if two numbers are equivalent, use normalized() on both version numbers before performing the compare.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] int QVersionNumber::segmentAt(int index) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the segement value at index. If the index does not exist, returns 0.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] int QVersionNumber::segmentCount() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the number of integers stored in segments().

db:section.db:title: QVector<int> QVersionNumber::segments() const
db:section.db:para: Returns all of the numerical segments.

db:section.db:title: QString QVersionNumber::toString() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a string with all of the segments delimited by a '.'.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool operator!=(const QVersionNumber &lhs, const QVersionNumber &rhs)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if lhs is not equal to rhs; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool operator<(const QVersionNumber &lhs, const QVersionNumber &rhs)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if lhs is less than rhs; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: QDataStream &operator<<(QDataStream &out, const QVersionNumber &version)
db:section.db:para: Writes the version number version to stream out.
Note that this has nothing to do with QDataStream::version().

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool operator<=(const QVersionNumber &lhs, const QVersionNumber &rhs)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if lhs is less than or equal to rhs; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool operator==(const QVersionNumber &lhs, const QVersionNumber &rhs)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if lhs is equal to rhs; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool operator>(const QVersionNumber &lhs, const QVersionNumber &rhs)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if lhs is greater than rhs; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] bool operator>=(const QVersionNumber &lhs, const QVersionNumber &rhs)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if lhs is greater than or equal to rhs; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: QDataStream &operator>>(QDataStream &in, QVersionNumber &version)
db:section.db:para: Reads a version number from stream in and stores it in version.
Note that this has nothing to do with QDataStream::version().
